comments:
I was adding a project to my workspace over a slow connection (JCore from SNZ to ZRH).
	After about half an hour I got a "CVS communication error" dialog
	with no further information (the log contained the stackt trace attached
	below). It seems that during the read the connection timed out.

	There are two things I would expect
	1) I would expect to be asked to retry (at the same position - not redo
		the work done in the last 30 minutes) - maybe the CVS client itself
		could retry several times before asking me.
	2) I would expect to be able to set the time out for each repository connection

Log: Fri Sep 07 15:59:18 GMT+02:00 2001
4 org.eclipse.vcm.ui 1 Errors adding project
	1=============<children>=============
	4 org.eclipse.vcm.core 4 CVS communication error
java.io.InterruptedIOException: Read timed out

NOTES:

A configurable timeout has been added to the CVS preferences page in build 205. 
Also, Replace with Stream Contents has been changed to only replaced changed 
resources. If communications is lost during this operation then redoing it will 
start where it left off. The same applies to add to workspace if the project 
was previously loaded. The only case not covered is if communciations is lost 
when adding a project for the first time. If this fails then all the sharing 
info is lost and the project will need to be reloaded.
